Cavs sew up seed
 




LeBron has carried his Cavs back into the playoffs.  (Getty Images)



    

    

      
      The Cavs grab the East's No. 2 seed with a 109-96 
      victory over the Bucks, while the Bulls 
      lose to the Nets 106-97 and slip to No. 5 to face the Heat. 
      Out West, the Warriors are in thanks to a 120-98 
      victory over the Blazers.
    

  
 Related Links:• East: Magic win | Wizards edge Pacers | Power Rankings | Reflections• Playoffs | West: Lakers lock up 7 seed | Clippers finished, lose finale


 


 

 





 Sa-weep ... Rangers take out Thrashers in four games


    

      
      It's not the debut Atlanta had in mind entering the playoffs. But it's 
      four-and-out as the New 
      York Rangers win 4-2 and become the first team advancing 
      into the next round.
    

  
• Devils win in OT | Sabres in control | Sharks up 3-1


 

 





 Pistone: Unwavering Martin to have first COT encounter


    

      
      It has been smooth sailing so far for Mark 
      Martin and his part-time schedule. But the real challenge 
      for the veteran should come in his first Car of Tomorrow race at Phoenix.
